teacheasy.test

Class Iteration1XMLTest

  • java.lang.Object
    • teacheasy.test.Iteration1XMLTest

  • public class Iteration1XMLTest
extends java.lang.Object
    This class tests the XML Parser and Writer using a JUnit automated test system.
    Version:
    1.0 01 Mar 2015
    Author:
    Sam Raeburn

    • Constructor Summary

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void checkColourFormatting()
      Check if error if a colour is given in wrong format (not hex)
      void checkDataIsCorrectlyStored()
      Check data is correctly stored once it has been parsed
      void checkDefaultStoredCorrectly()
      Check to see if defaults are stored correctly
      void checkGraphicLocation()
      Check if for graphic x/yend can be smaller than x/ystart
      void checkLocationToobig()
      Check if locations can be greater than 1 or negative
      void checkMissingDocumentInfo()
      Check how parser handles missing document info section
      void checkNoLocations()
      Check how parser handles an xml file which does not define locations
      void checkParserDefaults()
      Check how the parser handles missing default settings
      void checkParserWithMissingDataXML()
      Check that no error is returned if there is no audio, video or image data in a parsed XML file.
      void checkParserWithNoImageLocation()
      Check that the parser doesn't crash if an XML file has image with no file or location.
      void checkParserWithNonexistentXML()
      Parsing file that doesn't exist returns error
      void checkPassBoundary()
      Check pass boundary
      void checkWriterCreatesXML()
      Check to see that the writer creates a new XML document
      void checkWriterXMLIsCorrect()
      Check to see that the XML file created by the writer contains the correct data, since it has already been shown that the parser behaves as wished this can simply be done using the parser
